meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, let's get this review party started!

Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is like a warm hug on a chilly day. It's a delightful sequel that builds upon the original game, making it easy for new fans to jump in and experience the cuteness overload. Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about the old folks who played the first game?" Fear not, my friends, as this review is all about the gaming goodness that awaits both newcomers and seasoned players.

Let's start with the positives. The storytelling is top-notch, with each route taking a few hours to complete (depending on your reading speed). You'll get to see Lynette's married life in all its glory, tackling relatable issues with humor and wit. The eye-catching color palette and easy-to-use menus are perfect for a visual novel like Cupid Parasite. And, of course, who can resist the allure of multiple endings?

Now, about those critics... NintendoWorldReport praised the game's ability to subsume the original, making it accessible to newcomers. God is a Geek had a different take, saying it's hard to get into without playing the first game. Cubed3 and Digitally Downloaded loved the balanced backstory telling and the artful uniqueness of the game. Gamer Escape thought it should've been DLC (ouch!), while GLHF on Sports Illustrated found it all over the place - confusing and lost.

As for me? I'm a seasonal grok video game reviewer, and my motto is: "Gaming goodness awaits, even in the most unexpected places!" In this case, Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling delivers. It's a delightful sequel that builds upon the original, offering new fans a chance to experience the cuteness overload while providing returning players with more of the same - and that's all it needed to be.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a gaming experience that will leave you feeling warm and fuzzy inside (or at least entertained), Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is the way to go! So, grab some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy this delightful otome visual novel - Hippo Penny approved!
